sentence.Network_en: The audience thereupon rose cheering to their feet.
The knight carried a shield with a cross painted thereupon.
sentence.Network_cn: 骑士拿着绘着十字的盾牌.

sentence.Network_en: The police arrived. Thereupon the mob scattered.
sentence.Network_cn: 警察来了,这群乌合之众也随之散去.

entry.def: Thereupon means happening immediately after something else has happened and usually as a result of it.

example.ex: Some months ago angry demonstrators mounted a noisy demonstration beneath his window. His neighbours thereupon insisted upon more security.
example.tran: 几个月前，愤怒的示威者在他的窗下发起了闹哄哄的抗议活动，随后他的邻居们坚决要求加强安全防范。

auth_sentence.content: An unconstitutional Parliament thereupon declared the throne vacant.
auth_sentence.res_content: An unconstitutional Parliament thereupon declared the throne vacant.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: An unconstitutional Parliament thereupon declared the throne vacant.

auth_sentence.content: The president thereupon said he rejected the changes, which had been strongly backed by MPs and by many voters.
auth_sentence.res_content: The president thereupon said he rejected the changes, which had been strongly backed by MPs and by many voters.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The president thereupon said he rejected the changes, which had been strongly backed by MPs and by many voters.

sentences.en: Thereupon, we knew, our endeavor was valuable.
sentences.cn: 于是，我们知道，我们的努力是有价值的！
